pageTitle: 2nd-Quarter 2011 Airline Financial Data: Network Airlines, Low-Cost Airlines and Regional Airlines All Report Profits | Bureau of Transportation Statistics
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {54167=Ranked by 2nd Quarter 2011 Miscellaneous Operating Revenue, 76935=Ranked by Percent of 2nd Quarter 2011 Operating Revenue from Ancillary Revenue, 19788=The six network carriers posted a profit margin of 5.5 percent in the second quarter with a combined operating profit of $1.6 billion (Table 2).  In the second quarter of 2010, the network carriers reported a profit margin of 9.0 percent with a profit of $2.4 billion., 16791=Monday, November 7, 2011 - Scheduled passenger airlines reported a profit margin of 5.1 percent in the second quarter of 2011, up from the 0.5 percent loss margin in the first quarter but a smaller profit margin than the 9.0 percent margin during the second quarter of 2010, BTS reported today in a release of preliminary data (Table 1)., 151122=Ranked by 2nd Quarter 2011 Unit Costs (Cents Per ASM), 209164=Ranked by 2nd Quarter 2011 Revenue Yield (Cents Per RPM), 65299=Ranked by 2nd Quarter 2011 Ancillary Revenue, 180152=Ranked by 2nd Quarter 2011 Unit Revenue (Cents Per ASM), 112594=Ranked by 2nd Quarter 2011 Fuel Cost Per ASM (Cents Per ASM), 76162=** 28 carriers reported baggage fee, reservation change fee or miscellaneous operating revenue in 2Q 2011 (the sum of all carriers that reported in any one of the three categories)., 64735=** 27 carriers reported miscellaneous operating revenue in 2Q 2011, 17174=BTS, a part of the Research and Innovative Technology Administration, reported that the network airlines reported an operating profit margin of 5.5 percent as a group in the April-to-June period. The low-cost group's profit margin was 4.2 percent (Table 1). See Airline Financial Data Press Releases for historic data., 23335=Airline financial data from the second quarter of 2011 and previous quarters are posted on the BTS website. Data are compiled from quarterly financial and monthly traffic reports filed with BTS by commercial air carriers., 23647=Financial and traffic data are preliminary and include data received by BTS as of Oct. 20. Revised carrier data and late data filings will be made available monthly on TranStats on the Monday following the second Tuesday of the month. Data are subject to revision.  , 17843=Scheduled Passenger Airline Revenue from Baggage, Reservation Change Fees 1Q 2008-2Q 2011, 24115=Ranked by 2nd Quarter 2011 Margin, 37967=* 17 carriers reported baggage fee revenue in 2Q 2011, 18261=In addition to baggage and reservation change fees, airlines reported ancillary revenue of $709 million from passengers and from other sources. This revenue category includes revenue from frequent flyer award program mileage sales and pet transportation fees (Table 1D). Total second quarter 2011 airline revenue from all ancillary sources that can be identified, including fees and frequent flyer sales was $2.208 billion, with Delta Air Lines reporting the most, $691 million (Table 1E).  , 28482=Ranked by 2nd Quarter 2011 Baggage Fee Revenue, 53796=** Fee revenue for airlines reporting either baggage or reservation change fees. 18 airlines reported fees in 2Q 2011. Includes 4 airlines not listed in profit/loss column. 14 airlines are included in both columns., 17590=As part of their second-quarter revenue, the airlines collected $887 million in baggage fees (Table 1A) and $612 million from reservation change fees (Table 1B) from April to June., 47998=* 17 carriers reported reservation cancellation fee revenue in 2Q 2011, 38520=Ranked by 2nd Quarter 2011 Reservation Change Fee Revenue, 21521=For other second-quarter 2011 financial data with comparisons to previous quarters for carrier groups and for the largest network, low-cost and regional airlines, see the following tables: , 16441=Scheduled Passenger Airline Profit/Loss 1Q 2008-2Q 2011}
textBeforeTable: Excel | CSV (Operating Profit/Loss as Percent of Total Operating Revenue) Ranked by 2nd Quarter 2011 Margin Table 1: Passenger Airline System* Quarterly Operating Profit/Loss Margin (In Percent) Financial and traffic data are preliminary and include data received by BTS as of Oct. 20. Revised carrier data and late data filings will be made available monthly on TranStats on the Monday following the second Tuesday of the month. Data are subject to revision.   Airline financial data from the second quarter of 2011 and previous quarters are posted on the BTS website. Data are compiled from quarterly financial and monthly traffic reports filed with BTS by commercial air carriers. This release consists of domestic and international, or system, financial reports for the airlines. For additional revenue and operating profit/loss numbers, go to the BTS home page and use the links in the Airline Industry box. Reporting Notes For additional fee data, see tables for baggage fees and reservation change fees. For additional Miscellaneous Operating Revenue data, go to BTS Schedule P-1.2. Passenger Revenue Yield 17-20 Unit Revenues 13-16 Unit Costs 9-12 Fuel Costs 5-8 Ancillary Revenue Compared to Total Operating Revenue Table 1F Ancillary Revenue Table 1E Miscellaneous Operating Revenue (frequent flyer award program mileage sales and pet transportation fees) Table 1D Fees Compared to Profit/Loss Table 1C Reservation Change Fees Table 1B Baggage Fees Table 1A Operating Profit/Loss Margins
